trial_identification.studytitle: The effect of citalopram versus a placebo on central auditory processing in the elderly.
trial_identification.scientifictitle: The effect of citalopram versus a placebo on central auditory processing in the elderly.

interventions.interventions: citalopram 20 mg/day, in oral capsule, for 6 months; Medical consultation every 2 months for drug delivery. At same time, the adherence will be evaluated as well as collateral effects or even other clinical benefits from the drug.
interventions.comparator: placebo (starch pills) /day, in oral capsule, for 6 months.

primaryOutcome.outcome: Improvement in Central Auditory Test (Pitch Pattern sequence, Dichotic Digit Test)

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Patients handicap will be evaluated by Hearing Handicap Inventory for Elderly test (HHIE)
Cognitive status will be evaluated by Minimental Cognitive Test
Tinnitus will be evaluated by Tinnitus Handicap Inventory
Depression and humor status will be Beck Depression Inventory

eligibility.inclusivecriteria: Subjects with hearing threshold from normal to moderate loss and with low performance in central auditory processes tests.

trial_design.sequence: Simple randomisation using a randomisation table created by computer

sponsorship.primarysponsoraddress: Centro do Deficiente Auditivo - Federal University of Sao Paulo Borges Lagoa street, number 783 - 2nd. floor Vila Clementino - Sao Paulo - Sao Paulo postal code 04038-031

ethicsAndSummary.summary: Elderly with 60 years or more, with hearing impairment detected and confirmed by poor performance in Central Auditory Processing tests. 60 Subjects will be divided into two groups and given citalopram 20 mg/day or placebo for 6 months. Hearing evaluation will be performed initially and after 6 months and will include pure-tone audiometry, speech discrimination test (SDT), emittanciometry, hearing handicap inventory for elderly test (HHIE), minimental cognitive test and Central Auditory Processing evaluation.
ethicsAndSummary.publication: Serotonin reuptake inhibitors in auditory processing disorders in elderly patients: preliminary results. Cruz OL, Kasse CA, Sanchez M, Barbosa F, Barros FA. Laryngoscope. 2004;114(9):1656-9.

ethicscommitee.ethicname: Comite de Etica em Pesquisa - Unifesp/ hospital Sao Paulo
ethicscommitee.ethicaddress: Botucatu street, number 572, 1st floor Zip code 04023-061 Sao Paulo - Sao Paulo
